text: Joseph P. Ward is an American historian and author who currently serves as dean of The College of Humanities and Social Sciences at Utah State University. == Biography == Joseph Ward grew up in Southern New England, seeing massive upheaval from the loss of manufacturing jobs, a change he later credited for his interest in history.https://www.hjnews.com/allaccess/variety- in-your-diet-new-usu-dean-talks-vision- for/article_7194cf53-4eae-5460-8cb1-a7055ca30dcf.html Ward earned his Bachelor of Arts in history at University of Chicago and received a masters and a doctorate in history from Stanford University.https://www.usu.edu/today/?id=55940 http://history.olemiss.edu/london-a-social-and-cultural-history-1550-1750/ In 2017 he was madehttps://usustatesman.com/not-yet-wyoming-dean-added-provost- candidate/ the head of the search committee for Utah State's next provost, a position previously held by current president Noelle E. Cockett. That search eventually led to hiring of Frank Galey.https://www.cachevalleydaily.com/news/archive/2018/04/23/038eced8-46a5-11e8-bfb1-1fad57dd3d26/#.XTAInJPYrOQhttps://usustatesman.com/frank- galey-announced-usus-provost/ ==Career== *Visiting Instructor, Department of History, University of California, Davis, April–June 1992. *Assistant Professor, Department of History, Wayne State University, August 1992-July 1998. *Professor, Chair, Arch Dalrymple III Department of History, University of Mississippi, January 1997-July 2016. *Dean, College of Humanities and Social Sciences, Utah State University, since July 2016https://chass.usu.edu/people/deans- officehttps://history.usu.edu/faculty/faculty-directory/joe-ward * ==Works== * * * * ==Awards== *Donald R. Cole Excellence in Promoting Inclusiveness in Graduate Education Award - 2006 University of Mississippihttps://gradschool.olemiss.edu/awards-and-recognitions/ ==Personal life== Ward is married to Sue Grayzel,https://assets.cambridge.org/97805218/74946/frontmatter/9780521874946_frontmatter.pdfhttps://www.scribd.com/book/322772996/Women- s-Identities-at-War-Gender-Motherhood-and-Politics-in-Britain-and-France- during-the-First-World-War another American academic historian.https://libarts.olemiss.edu/grayzel-named-director-of-um-sarah-isom- center-for-women-and-gender-studies/ ==References== Category:Living people Category:American writers Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
